Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.oath

Class OathFactory

java.lang.Object
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.oath.OathFactory
public final class OathFactory extends Object
A factory for creating objects that produce or affect OATH (or its relatives) OTPs.
Since:
4.0

  • Method Details

    • createGemaltoOathDevice

      public final GemaltoOathDevice createGemaltoOathDevice(OathToken token) throws IdpException
      Creates a Hardware or Software Gemalto OATH device for the given OATH token. Warning! Currently Mobile Protector SDK library only supports Software Gemalto OATH device.

      If the token is soft, i.e Token.isSoft() is true, the default Gemalto OATH settings are used, otherwise the device settings are used.

      Parameters:
      token - the token
      Returns:
      a Gemalto OATH device object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the token type is unknown.
      IllegalStateException - when the token's key is not a 20 byte key.
      IllegalStateException - when the token supports more than one key ( OathToken.TokenCapability ) and its key has not been selected. Applies to tokens that implement SelectableKey.selectKey(int) , e.g. DualSeedSoftOathToken .
      IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
      IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
      DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
      PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
      Since:
      4.0

    • createSoftGemaltoOathDevice

      public final GemaltoOathDevice createSoftGemaltoOathDevice(SoftOathToken token, SoftGemaltoOathSettings settings) throws IdpException
      Creates a customized soft Gemalto OATH device.
      Parameters:
      token - the token
      settings - the Gemalto OATH settings
      Returns:
      a Gemalto OATH device.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the OATH key is not 20 bytes
      IllegalStateException - when the token supports more than one key ( OathToken.TokenCapability ) and its key has not been selected. Applies to tokens that implement SelectableKey.selectKey(int) , e.g. DualSeedOathToken .
      IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
      IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
      DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
      PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
      Since:
      4.0

    • createSoftGemaltoOathSettings

      public final SoftGemaltoOathSettings createSoftGemaltoOathSettings()
      Creates a mutable Gemalto OATH settings.
      Returns:
      new mutable settings based on the default settings
      Since:
      4.0

    • createSoftOathDevice

      public final OathDevice createSoftOathDevice(OathToken token) throws IdpException
      Creates a Hardware or Software OATH device for the given OATH token. Warning! Currently Mobile Protector SDK library only supports Software OATH device.

      If the token is soft, i.e Token.isSoft() is true, the default Gemalto OATH settings are used, otherwise the device settings are used.

      Parameters:
      token - the token
      Returns:
      the OATH device
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the token is not a soft token.
      IllegalStateException - when the OATH key is not 20, 32 or 64 bytes
      IllegalStateException - when the token supports more than one key ( OathToken.TokenCapability ) and its key has not been selected. Applies to tokens that implement SelectableKey.selectKey(int) , e.g. DualSeedSoftOathToken .
      IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
      IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
      DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
      PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
      Since:
      4.0

    • createSoftOathDevice

      public final OathDevice createSoftOathDevice(SoftOathToken token, SoftOathSettings settings) throws IdpException
      Creates a customized soft OATH device using the specified settings.
      Parameters:
      token - the token
      settings - the OATH settings
      Returns:
      the OATH device
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - when the OATH key is not 20, 32 or 64 bytes
      IllegalStateException - when the token supports more than one key ( OathToken.TokenCapability ) and its key has not been selected. Applies to tokens that implement SelectableKey.selectKey(int) , e.g. DualSeedSoftOathToken .
      IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
      IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
      DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
      PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
      Since:
      4.0

    • createSoftOathSettings

      public final SoftOathSettings createSoftOathSettings()
      Creates a OATH settings.
      Returns:
      new OATH settings based on the default OATH settings
      Since:

    • createSoftDcvOathDevice

      public final DcvOathDevice createSoftDcvOathDevice(OathToken token) throws IdpException
      Creates a Hardware or Software DCV OATH device for the given OATH token. Warning! Currently Mobile Protector SDK library only supports Software OATH device.

      If the token is soft, i.e Token.isSoft() is true, the default Gemalto OATH settings are used, otherwise the device settings are used.

      Parameters:
      token - the token
      Returns:
      the DCV OATH device
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when the token is not a soft token.
      IllegalStateException - when the OATH key is not 20, 32 or 64 bytes
      IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
      IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
      DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
      PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers).
      Since:
      4.1
